intro: Aulacospermum tenuisectum, commonly known as the slender-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that contain seeds coated in a sticky substance to aid in seed dispersal. Aulacospermum tenuisectum is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in shaded, humid environments.
